course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Race, Place &Political Economy
class_notes: This course examines the political, racial, and economic evolution of American cities and towns in the post-Civil Rights Movement era. The first half of the course focuses on dominant themes in political economy, political geography, and political behavior literature. The intersection of race and class at the local level is addressed, while exploring issues of institutional discrimination and redistribution. The second part of the course, applies learned concepts and ideas to 4 case studies: deindustrialization in Chicago, the rural healthcare crisis in Mississippi, rapid population change in Atlanta, and public education funding in Los Angeles. Students will gain an understanding of how the local political economy shapes opportunity, mobility, and racial relations in America.
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
